Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the statement that Barack Obama said, "If we keep talking about the economy, we’re going to lose."
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that the quote is accurate and taken in context, without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the quote was taken out of context and does not accurately represent what Barack Obama said in his speech.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the implications of the quote by suggesting that it means Obama believes his economic record is so bad that he will lose in 2012 unless he can steer the conversation away from the economy.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a complete and accurate representation of the context in which the quote was made.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the quote, which is that Obama was actually referring to his opponent's campaign three years earlier saying, "If we keep talking about the economy, we're going to lose." This alternative explanation is not included in the claim.
